title: Two More Police Officers Who Responded to Jan. 6 Capitol Attack Died by Suicide
sub_head: Deaths bring number of suicides among officers engaged during riot to four
body:
WASHINGTON—Washington’s Metropolitan Police Department said that two more officers who responded to the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol have died by suicide.
That raises to four the known number of suicides by police officers who defended the complex after supporters of then-President Donald Trump stormed the U.S. Capitol, temporarily interrupting the certification of President Biden’s victory in the November election.
The toll comprises three officers from the Metropolitan Police Department and one officer from the Capitol Police.
Officer Gunther Hashida was found dead on July 29, the Metropolitan Police Department said Monday. Officer Kyle DeFreytag was found dead on July 10, the department said.
“We are unable to determine if the officers’ deaths are linked to January 6 events,” department spokeswoman Kristen Metzger said Tuesday.
